Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text (divorce) on recto. The text records the divorce of Pati[pa]rewy from his wife Takhet[-...], and is dated to 'year 31, first month of the season of Achet under Pharaoh Darius (I)' (24 Dec.-23 Jan. 492-1 BC). Thompson's MS Catalogue: "recto 8 ll. verso pasted down. [...] Scribe. Horuz son of Nes-Hor-pechrat".
Curator's comments: To be included in the 'Musee achemenide virtuel et interactif' (see www.achemenet.com) Published: J. Curtis and N. Tallis (eds.), Forgotten Empire: The World of Ancient Persia, London 2005, p. 199 [315] Published: Cruz-Uribe in Fs Lüddeckens, 43-46. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Curtis & Tallis 2005 / Forgotten Empire: The world of Ancient Persia (cat. 315)
Cruz-Uribe 1984 / A Look at Two Early Divorce Documents (p. 43-6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (46071) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/46071)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006 7 Mar-11 Jun, Barcelona, Fundacion La Caixa, 'L'imperi Oblidat' 2005-2006 Sept-Jan, London, BM, 'Forgotten Empire'
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Checked for temporary exhibition Room 5 2005 Checked for loan to Spain 2006 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
Acquisition notes: Appears in Herbert Thompson, Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum (1883) [MS in Dept. Archive].
